sen.j: 1906年（明治39年）、当時東京市内に路面電車を運行していた東京電車鉄道、東京市街鉄道、東京電気鉄道の三社が合併して東京鉄道とすることとした。
sen.e: In 1906 it was decided that three railroad companies which ran trams within Tokyo City, Tokyo Densha Tetsudo, Tokyo Shigai Tetsudo and Tokyo Denki Tetsudo were merged under the new name of Tokyo Tetsudo.

It was decided in 1906 that three railroad companies called Tokyo Densha Tetsudo (Tokyo Train Railway), Tokyo Shigai Tetsudo (Tokyo City Railway) and Tokyo Denki Tetsudo (Tokyo Electric Railway) that ran streetcars within Tokyo City in those days merged under the new name of Tokyo Tetsudo.

sen.j: 当時各社3銭、他社線に乗り換えるとさらに3銭の運賃体系となっていた。
sen.e: At that time when users changed to the line of other companies, they were charged extra 3 sen.
Each company costed three sen (hundredth of a yen), and extra three yen was charged for changing to the train line of another company.

sen.j: 当時の利用客からは全社共通運賃を望む声が多く、また全社日露戦争によって課せられた通行税によって経営を圧迫していたため、三社合併と同時に運賃を4銭均一制とすることにした。
sen.e: As much of the users of those days demanded a standardized fare and all the three companies suffered from the new tax on transportation which begun with the Japanese-Russo War, they decided to merge and fix the fare to 4 sen.

As much of the commuters of those days demanded a standardized fare and all companies suffered from the new transportation tax due to the Russo-Japanese War, they decided to merge and fix the fare to four sen.

sen.e: However, people strongly objected the raise of the fare, and as the date came, they started to hold a public gathering for objection to it.

sen.e: Then they became violent and repeated violence like throwing stones or firing trains.

sen.e: These incidents also left the growing demand for the public operation of railroad companies, and resulted in the acquisition by Tokyo City in 1911.

sen.j: 1914年（大正3年）、名古屋市において路面電車を運営していた名古屋電気鉄道（名電）に対し、不況下（当時はまだ、第一次世界大戦が勃発した直後）のもと市民は運賃の高さに不満を持っていた。
sen.e: In 1914, Nagoyo Denki Testudo ran trams within Nagoua City but people under the economy depression (it was just soon after the first World Wide War occurred) were frustrated with the high price of the fare.

sen.j: 名電の運賃値上げを機にその不満が噴出し、市内路線の事業独占を糾弾すべくデモクラシー運動を展開する団体が鶴舞公園で主催した「電車賃値下問題市民大会」に多数が集まった。
sen.e: The frustration became more apparent when Nagoya Denki Tetsudo raised the fare, and to accuse their monopoly supply of the railroad service within the city, one democracy organization held "Public Meeting Concerning The Drop Of The Train Fare" at the Tsurumai park and many people gathered there.

sen.j: 会終了後に高揚した一部の参加者が暴徒と化し、偶々近くを走行していた市内電車や、郡部線（郊外路線）のターミナル駅であった柳橋駅、隣接の名電本社へ破壊・放火するなどの事態に発展し、本社建屋・柳橋駅舎と電車23両などが被災（焼失・破壊）した。
sen.e: After the end of the meeting, part of the participants became so violent that they destructed and fire the city train that was running around them, the Yanagibashi station that was a terminal port for the suburbs lines, the main shrine of Nagoya Denki Tetsudo. As a result, the building of the company, the facilities of the Yanagibashi station and 23 trains were destructed by fire.

Some participants resulted to violence at the end of the meeting, and the situation developed into the destruction and arson of city train running across every parts of the city, facilities of the Yanagibashi station that was a terminal port for the suburban line, headquarter of Nagoya Denki Tetsudo adjacent to it, and 23 trains.

sen.j: これによって、名古屋市当局は市内路線の市有化を強力に求めるべきとの考えを強め、事態収拾のため25年後までの市有化（市内全路線の譲渡）を名電に約束させ、1922年（大正11年）に名古屋電気鉄道の名古屋鉄道と名古屋市電への分割・事業譲渡として結実した。
sen.e: Due to this incident, the authorities of Nagoya city came to realize the necessity of promoting the municipalization of railroad lines in the city, and to settle the situation let Nagoya Denki Tetsudo make an promise they would cede the right of the all lines to the Nagoya city within the next 25 years, and in 1922, the business of Nagoya Denki Tetsudo was spilt and succeed by Nagoya Tetsudo and Nagoya Shiden.
